item.title: React Router Basics
item.description: ReactDOM.render(( <Router history={browserHistory}> <Route path='/' component={Users} /> <Route path='/other' component={Other} /> </Router> ), document.getElementById('root')) history is required. What we did above is we mounted a Router to the DOM, it is now going to take Routes. A route takes a path (URL) and shows a component on that path. Link If you want to navigate anywhere within the site, you use Link. You’ll only use actual href when you want to move away from the site.
